TopicTitle: Even with MechJeb my rocket is too powerful and ends up overshooting the ascent path

Articles.Content:
Hello,

I was hoping getting MechJeb's ascent guidance module would help me automate the launch but I can't quite follow the ascent path.  Seems like my rocket is too powerful so I've tried to limit throttle and/or acceleration during ascent but it's very clumsy and it usually works poorly.

http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198276590575/screenshot/499154497084905198

 

Is this a rocket design flaw or are there smarter parameters in the ascent guidance?

wrong image link

It could also be a control authority issue - in other words, you ask the rocket to turn faster than its steering systems are physically capable of executing.

In your MechJeb control panel, you have set the turn start for 3.5 km or 100 m/s. Try lowering this. I'm not sure which of the two is hit first, since I don't know your rocket, but 3.5 km is pretty high, so I'm guessing that it's speed. Try setting it to 75 m/s or even 50 m/s.

This will cause your rocket to start the turn sooner, which does two things: first, it has more time to turn over, since it starts lower down. Second, it will naturally tend to tilt over faster, since it is going slower at the time, which removes the need for strong steering input.
